net.edzard.kinetic

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
      • net.edzard.kinetic.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Container, Shape

    public abstract class Node
extends com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject
    Base class for all of the Kinetic classes. Contains functionality for:
    • Event handling
    • Naming
    • Positioning, Rotation and Scaling
    • Visibility
    Author:
    Ed

      • getAttr

        public final <T> T getAttr(java.lang.String attr)
        Gets attribute value for specified key. Can be Kinetic attrs and custom attrs as well.
        Parameters:
        attr - the key
        Returns:
        the value - boxed value

      • setAttr

        public final void setAttr(java.lang.String attr,
           int value)
        Sets an attribute value for specified key. Can be used to set Kinetic attrs, or even custom attrs. TODO: Custom attr changes can also be subscribed to, just like Kinetic attrs. i.e. shape.on('myAttrChange', ...);
        Parameters:
        attr - the key - boxed value

      • getNodeType

        public final java.lang.String getNodeType()
        Gets the type of this node. One of: "Stage", "Layer", "Group", or "Shape".
        Returns:
        node type

      • getClassName

        public final java.lang.String getClassName()

        Returns:
        class name

      • getWidth

        public final double getWidth()
        Gets the width of the node.
        Returns:
        node Width of the node

      • setWidth

        public final void setWidth(double width)
        Sets the width of the node. Uses bounding boxes around select nodes. For example, to define the size of an ellipse, you could set its width and height rather than setting the radius.
        Parameters:
        width - pixels in width

      • getHeight

        public final double getHeight()
        Gets the width of the node.
        Returns:
        node Width of the node

      • setHeight

        public final void setHeight(double height)
        Sets the height of the node. Uses bounding boxes around select nodes. For example, to define the size of an ellipse, you could set its width and height rather than setting the radius.
        Parameters:
        width - pixels in height

      • getSize

        public final Vector2d getSize()
        Retrieve the size of the node (in-built rectangle wrapping it seems).
        Returns:
        The node's size (x component is width, y component is height)

      • setSize

        public final void setSize(Vector2d size)
        Assign new size to the node.
        Parameters:
        size - The node's new size (x component is width, y component is height)

      • getAbsoluteOpacity

        public final double getAbsoluteOpacity()
        Retrieve the node's absolute opacity.
        Returns:

      • moveTo

        public final void moveTo(Container newContainer)
        Move this node into the specified container.
        Parameters:
        newContainer - The container to move this node to.

      • moveToTop

        public final void moveToTop()
        Moves the node to the highest Z position. It will be in front of all of the other nodes on a given layer. Node needs to belong to a layer.

      • moveToBottom

        public final void moveToBottom()
        Moves the node to the lowest Z position. It will be behind all of the other nodes on a given layer. Node needs to belong to a layer.

      • moveUp

        public final void moveUp()
        Increases the Z position of the node. Node needs to belong to a layer.

      • moveDown

        public final void moveDown()
        Decreases the Z position of the node. Node needs to belong to a layer.

      • getZIndex

        public final int getZIndex()
        Get the current Z position of the node relative to the container. Node needs to belong to a layer.
        Returns:
        The Z position

      • setZIndex

        public final void setZIndex(int z)
        Sets the Z position of the node. Node needs to belong to a layer.
        Parameters:
        z - A new Z position

      • setListening

        public final void setListening(boolean listening)
        Enable or disable event handling.
        Parameters:
        listening - True, if events should be handled. False, otherwise.

      • setListeningPrivate

      • getName

        Retrieve a node's name.
        Returns:
        The name or null if not set.

      • setName

        public final void setName(java.lang.String newName)
        Set a name for this node. Names do not have to be unique - two nodes with the same name can exist.
        Parameters:
        newName - A name.

      • getOpacity

        public final double getOpacity()
        Retrieve the opacity of the complete node.
        Returns:
        A value between 0 and 1. 0 is complete transparency and 1 is complete opaque.

      • setOpacity

        public final void setOpacity(double opacity)
        Set the opacity of the complete node.
        Parameters:
        opacity - A value between 0 and 1. 0 is complete transparency and 1 is complete opaque.

      • getScale

        public final Vector2d getScale()
        Retrieve the node's scaling.
        Returns:
        The two scaling components. The x component holds the horizontal scale, while y holds the vertical scale.

      • setScale

        public final void setScale(Vector2d scale)
        Set scaling for the node.
        Parameters:
        scale - The two scaling components. The x component holds the horizontal scale, while y holds the vertical scale.

      • getRotation

        public final double getRotation()
        Retrieve the node's rotation in radians.
        Returns:
        The rotation

      • setRotation

        public final void setRotation(double rot)
        Set the node's rotation.
        Parameters:
        rot - The rotation in radians

      • getOffset

        public final Vector2d getOffset()
        Retrieve the node's center offset. The center offset is used during transformations (positioning, scaling, rotation)
        Returns:
        The center offset

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(Vector2d offset)
        Assign the node's center offset. The center offset is used during transformations (positioning, scaling, rotation)
        Parameters:
        offset - The node center's offset

      • setDraggable

        public final void setDraggable(boolean drag)
        Enable or disable dragging of the node.
        Parameters:
        drag - True, if the node should be dragable. False, if not.

      • isDraggable

        public final boolean isDraggable()
        Checks if a node can be dragged.
        Returns:
        True, in case that the node can be dragged. False, otherwise.

      • addEventListener

        public final void addEventListener(IEventListener handler,
                    NamedEventType... events)
        Register an event listener for arbitrary many basic or named events.
        Parameters:
        type - all the events to register the handler for
        handler - the handler

      • removeEventListener

        public final void removeEventListener(NamedEventType... events)
        Remove an event listener from the node for designated events (either basic or named).
        Parameters:
        eventTypes - A number of event types to stop listening to

      • remove

        public final void remove()
        Removes this node from its parent but doesn't destroy.

      • simulate

        public final void simulate(java.lang.String event)
        Simulates the firing of an event. This will trigger the appropriate listeners with empty event objects.
        Parameters:
        type - The event type to simulate

      • toJSON

        public final java.lang.String toJSON()
        Write the current node's definition to JSON. Doesn't serialize functions and images. These need to be written manually.
        Returns:
        A JSON representation of the node

      • toMyJSON

        @Deprecated
public final java.lang.String toMyJSON(com.google.gwt.core.client.JsArrayString attrsToPrint)
        Deprecated. 
        Writes the current node's definition to JSON. Only serializes attributes defined in the parameter. Doesn't serialize functions, images, DOM objects or objects with methods. RED ALERT: this method uses a modified version of kinetic's "toJSON" method (see below) which is not a part of the standard KineticJS distribution and hence this method is deprecated. It is safe to use this method with the bundled "dev" version, but beware using it in production with a "min" version for example. Should you choose to do so, you can always add the modified function yourselves: toMyJSON: function(attrsToPrint) { return JSON.stringify(this.toObject(), attrsToPrint, '\t'); }
        Parameters:
        attrsToPrint - attributes to serialize Recommended default code: JsArrayString jsonAttrsToSerialize = (JsArrayString) JsArrayString.createArray(); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("attrs"); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("x"); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("y"); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("id"); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("className"); jsonAttrsToSerialize.push("children");
        Returns:
        A JSON representation of the node. Formatted with a tabulator.
